comment.author: 74382902@N00
comment._content: I have always loved the dresses and hair from the 1880s.  Fabulous photo.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
She must have been related somehow to lumber baron and former Michigan Governor Henry Howland Crapo. Another Crapo relative was William Crapo Durant, who started General Motors.

In this photo, she is smiling because she has just hit the paper target with her handgun.
[O.K., I made that up about the gun . . . ]

comment.author: 23723386@N07
comment._content:
Letta was the daughter of Humphrey Howland Crapo-Smith and Lucy Crapo Crapo-Smith. Lucy Crapo was the daughter of Governor Henry Howland Crapo and the sister of Rebecca Crapo Durant (Billy Durant's mother). 

Humphrey Howland Crapo-Smith must have been a cousin... and you know how things were then... marrying cousins and all.

comment.author: 17935505@N04
comment._content: From the hair and dress it looks like this photo is from the late 1880's. Ferdinand Friend was in business in 1880-81 as Friend and Owen, at 244 & 246 Woodward. Owen isn't listed in 1883 - but the address is still 244-46 until 1884. In 1884 its only 244 Woodward, and It stays like that until at least 1890. If you blow uo the photo you can see that she isn't holding a gun - although it does look like it. The loop around her thumb is cloth - a handkerchief or scarf, that drapes over her hand. Above it is a rectangular object that might be a book, wallet, or even her eyeglass case.

comment.author: 33430073@N03
comment._content: I wrote about her on my blog, if you want to know more about her family, painting, and travels in Europe. She is a fascinating character. www.belleislehome.com/2010/11/on-trail-of-miss-letta-crap...
